properties.title: St Mary's Church

properties.address: Wellbeing Media Studio, Bedford, Bedfordshire MK42 0AS
properties.description: We are open for co-working April 30, and subsequent Wednesdays until June 11, from 10.00-1.30, and then will be closed until OCTOBER when our Warm and Welcome space opens again Facilities: Disabled toilet/wheelchair access Tea and Coffee (in a kitchenette) and we'll have biscuits Free Wifi and charging facilities (ie plugs) TV Small book library/swap Desk/Co Working space Other information: We would like to start activities if we see there is need, and hope to have visits from community support organisations - but we have leaflets and information. We can provide a talking space - as the owner is a qualified Coach and Chartered Psychologist. We can only welcome a maximum of 15 people as our space isn't huge. We don't have specific facilities for children, but they can accompany their parents as long as they are never left without them.
properties.title: Wellbeing Media Studio

properties.title: Bedford Caribbean Senior Citizens Association

properties.description:
Free car parking, free computers/devices for use, free Wi-Fi, charging facilities, hot/cold snacks and drinks, play equipment/toys, disabled toilets, baby changing facilities.

Run by volunteers from the Bhagwan Valmik Sabha Bedford and staff from Queen’s Park community Organisation (QPCO).

QPCO will be delivering Carbon monoxide workshops, handing out CO2 monitors, slow cooking lessons and educating individuals on the benefits of the Cadent Priority Services Register (PSR).

Regular visits from statutory groups.

Punjabi interpreters on site. 

Arts and crafts activities.

Advice and signposting available. 

Wednesday sessions during the holiday for children. See: qpco.org.uk/projects/welcoming-space

properties.description:
Deaf Space information, advice and guidance service is also freely available at CVS Bedford on Thursdays for BSL users. 

Guests are welcome to purchase tea / coffee / other drinks each at £1 if they wish, but there is no obligation. Guests are welcome to bring lunch with them and biscuits will be offered. Accessible parking and entrance, free parking, free Wi-Fi, charging facilities, accessible toilets, baby changing facilities

. This space is tailored for people who are deaf or hard of hearing and is inclusive for BSL users.

properties.description:
Hot drinks and sandwiches can be purchased from the Salvation Army coffee shop.

Most people that attend the drop-in are BSL users however everyone is welcome.

If you’re nervous about joining, look out for volunteers wearing the Access Bedford t-shirt who will introduce you to people.
